title: Sun square Mercury
summary: A tension between intention and interpretation. Thoughts, words, and self-understanding don't line up cleanly, increasing the chance of miscommunication and mental friction. The task is to slow down and realign meaning before acting.

meaning.headline: What you mean and what comes out may not match yet.

frames.text: Sun-Mercury squares surface gaps between identity and thinking-what feels true internally may not be articulated clearly.
Mental friction often appears when decisions are made before understanding is complete.
Conversations may require extra clarification to avoid talking past one another.
Self-doubt can spike when thoughts lag behind intent.
This means you can't think clearly today.

do: Slow conversations down and ask for confirmation.
Write before you speak if clarity matters.
Treat confusion as information, not failure.
Restate what you've heard to ensure alignment.
Allow ideas to evolve before locking decisions.
avoid: Making snap judgments under mental pressure
Talking through issues just to relieve tension

reusable_lines.text: Clarity comes from alignment, not speed.
If something feels off, pause and refine the message.

forbidden_claims: Deterministic statements about confusion or failure
Negative judgments about intelligence or competence
allowed_framing: Agency-forward framing: 'you can slow this down...'

sources: Sun-Mercury square as identity/thought tension archetype
